intro: Pelecyphora dasyacantha subsp. dasyacantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
